# Setup

```{r}
#| label: load-packages
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(colorspace)
library(openintro)
library(gghighlight)
library(scales)
```

# Part 1 - Labeling states

```{r, fig.width = 9, fig.height = 6}
ggplot(state_stats, aes(x = homeownership, y = pop2010)) + 
  geom_text(aes(label = abbr), vjust = 0.5, hjust = 0.5, check_overlap = TRUE) + 
  labs(title = "Homeownership by State and Population in 2010", 
       x = "Homeownership", 
       y = "2010 Population") + 
  theme(axis.title.x = element_text(margin = margin(t = 10)), axis.title.y = element_text(margin = margin(t = 10))) + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels = label_number(scale = 1/1000000, suffix = "M")) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels = label_percent(scale = 1)) +
  theme_economist()
```

# Part 2 - Another look at Durham AQI

```{r}
#| label: durham-aqi-prep
#| message: false

dch_2022 <- read_csv(here::here("data/durham-chapel-hill/ad_aqi_tracker_data-2022.csv"), na = c(".", ""))

aqi_levels <- tribble(
  ~aqi_min, ~aqi_max, ~color,    ~level,
  0,        50,       "#D8EEDA", "Good",
  51,       100,      "#F1E7D4", "Moderate",
  101,      150,      "#F8E4D8", "Unhealthy for sensitive groups",
  151,      200,      "#FEE2E1", "Unhealthy",
  201,      300,      "#F4E3F7", "Very unhealthy",
  301,      400,      "#F9D0D4", "Hazardous"
) |>
  mutate(aqi_mid = (aqi_min + aqi_max) / 2)

dch_2022 <- dch_2022 |>
  janitor::clean_names() |>
  mutate(date = mdy(date))
```

Complete the plot below.

```{r}
#| label: durham-aqi-viz

dch_2022 |>
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = aqi_value, group = 1)) +
  geom_line(size = 1, na.rm = TRUE) +
  scale_x_date(
    name = NULL, date_labels = "%b",
    limits = c(ymd("2022-01-01"), ymd("2023-03-01"))
  ) +
  geom_text(
    data = aqi_levels, aes(x = ymd("2023-02-28"), y = aqi_mid, label = level, color = color), fontface = "bold", size = 5, hjust = 1
  ) +
  scale_color_identity() +
  annotate(
    geom = "text",
    x = c(ymd("2022-01-01"), ymd("2023-01-01")), y = -80,
    label = c("2022", "2023"), size = 4
  ) +
  coord_cartesian(clip = "off", ylim = c(0, 400)) +
  labs(
    x = NULL, y = "AQI",
    title = "Ozone and PM2.5 Daily AQI Values",
    subtitle = "Durham-Chapel Hill, NC",
    caption = "Source: EPA Daily Air Quality Tracker"
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(0,50,100,150,200,300,400)) +
  theme(panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank(), 
        panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
        plot.caption = element_text(vjust = -2))
```

# Part 3 - Highlighting with gghighlight

```{r}
#| label: sf-data-prep
#| message: false

sf_files <- fs::dir_ls(here::here("data/san-francisco"))

sf <- read_csv(sf_files, na = c(".", ""))

sf <- sf |>
  janitor::clean_names() |>
  mutate(date = mdy(date)) |>
  arrange(date) |>
  select(date, aqi_value) |>
  mutate(
    year = year(date),
    day_of_year = yday(date)
  )
```

```{r}
#| label: sf-data-viz

ggplot(sf, aes(x = day_of_year, y = aqi_value, group = year)) + 
  geom_line(color = "gray") + 
  geom_line(data = sf %>%
              filter(year == 2016), 
            color = "red") +
  labs(title = "AQI levels in SF in 2016", 
       subtitle = "Verses all years 2016-2022", 
       x = "Day of year", 
       y = "AQI value")
```
